duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide leadership and direction to ensure compliance with quality standards, regulatory requirements, and partner commitments.
Lead deviation investigations, CAPAs, and Change Controls to ensure compliance and timeliness.
Support client due diligence, Quality audits, and regulatory inspections.
Implement and grow phase-appropriate quality systems for cGMP manufacturing.
Provide guidance to other departments on GMP principles and compliance.
Notify Senior Management of potential quality or regulatory issues affecting product quality.

education_certification.credential: Master’s degree in a science-related field with 10 years of related experience, and 5 years of supervisory experience; OR Bachelor’s degree in a science-related field with 12 years of related experience, and 5 years of supervisory experience. At least 8 years of cGMP experience.
Degree in Biology, Chemistry or Engineering
